Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Metro-Gold’ offers the prized Manila clam flavor: exceptionally sweet and buttery with minimal chewiness and a clean, briny finish. The meat is tender and plump, ranging from creamy beige to subtle orange when cooked. The shells are oval-shaped with distinctive concentric rings and a beautiful golden-brown coloration that makes them stand out from common clams. Their consistent small size ensures even cooking and perfect single-bite portions.

2. The Sweet, Versatile Bivalve This clam’s superior sweetness and tender texture make it ideal for both simple and complex preparations where its flavor can shine.

  • Clams in White Wine Sauce: The premier preparation - steamed quickly with garlic, white wine, and butter until they just open, creating a sublime broth.
  • Pasta alle Vongole: The classic Italian pasta dish where their sweet flavor and tender texture perfectly complement garlic, olive oil, and parsley.
  • Clam Chowder: Provides sweet, tender morsels for both creamy New England and clear broth Manhattan-style chowders.
  • Raw on the Half-Shell: Small, premium specimens can be served raw with a squeeze of lemon or mignonette sauce.

3. The Harvest & Growth Cycle ‘Metro-Gold’ is a rapid-growing, prolific burrower that thrives in 5-10 cm of coarse sand or specialized substrate. They actively filter feed, improving water clarity and quality. In a Haloponic™ substrate bed, a square meter can yield 3-5 kg of premium clams over an 8-10 week cycle, reaching optimal harvest size of 3.5 cm in as little as 7 weeks from juvenile seeding.
